name: Spaghetti alla Carbonara
ingredients: 1 cup freshly grated pecorino romano cheese
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_method:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package instructions.
2. In a large skillet, cook guanciale or pancetta over medium heat until crispy.
3. In a small bowl, whisk together eggs, pecorino romano cheese, garlic, salt, and pepper.
4. Drain spaghetti and add to the skillet with the guanciale or pancetta. Toss to coat.
5. Remove from heat and add egg mixture, tossing quickly to prevent the eggs from scrambling.
6. Serve immediately, garnished with additional pecorino romano cheese and black pepper.

name: Risotto ai Funghi
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_method:
1. In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until translucent.
2. Add mushrooms and cook until softened.
3. Add Arborio rice and stir to coat with the oil and mushrooms. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
4. Add white wine and stir until absorbed.
5. Gradually add hot stock, 1 cup at a time, stirring constantly and waiting for each addition to be absorbed before adding the next.
6. Continue to cook and stir until rice is tender and creamy.
7. Remove from heat and stir in butter and parmesan cheese.
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Serve hot.

name: Pesto alla Genovese
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
cooking_method:
1. In a food processor, combine basil leaves, parmesan cheese, pine nuts, and garlic. Pulse until finely chopped.
2. With the food processor running, slowly pour in the olive oil until the pesto is smooth and well combined.
3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
4. Serve with pasta, bread, or vegetables.
